Comments_List: I achieved a basic understanding of economics and market structures and theory.
The course did give a foundation to microeconomics as promised. I developed a mix of conceptual and mathematic skills.

This course gives a terrific overview of all topics in microeconomics, including supply, demand, game theory, market structures, labor, and capital.  The course blends social science and quantitative reasoning through readings and problem sets during the course, and a mix of essay and math questions on the exams.
How to go around life, how economics work
I learned about the laws of supply and demand, elasticity, price floors and ceilings, different types of firms, and an assortment of other topics
Learned how individuals make economic decisions.
an microeconomic perspective of viewing not only the financial world but also decision making in every way.
I learned the basics of microeconomics specifically optimization.
This is a very interesting course, I wish I had not taken it online because it would have been much better in person.
Exams were harder than problem sets but all the content was very useful
The teaching was very strong and the open note exams were also very generous
You can watch the video lectures at your own pace which helps with absorbing the material.
The online environment is very interactive and I gained a lot. But meeting duration could be increased to 2 hours since the content is complex.
The professor and TA were very accessible, but the discussion sections could have been more structured.
Yes, a very interesting course that has a lot of value and can be applied in many areas of life.
I would definitely recommend this class!  It is necessary if you're an Econ major, but even otherwise, it provides lots of information that is important to understanding the world around us.
Yes, it is a great way to get introduced to economics without having a background of Econ.
I would because the topics covered in this class are fundamental and important for every student to have some knowledge of.
Yes, online office hours for the PSETs are very helpful, and Tolga is very helpful with feedback whenever necessary.
Yes I would. this is a foundation course for microeconomics therefore it is very critical. besides, Prof. Koker is a brilliant teacher and the classes have been interesting and beneficial.
If interested it is a good way to receive the basic information on economics.
